alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 30 at 2:11AM CST until November 30 at 4:00AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, Greene, Perry and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 515 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 210 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richton, State Line, Piave, Sand Hill, Bothwell, Smithtown, Avera, Brewer, East Side, Good Hope, Old Avera, McSwain, Clark, Knobtown, Battles, Eret, Runnelstown, Tallahala, Corinth and Indian Springs.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
